titleStmt.title: The Third Part of King Henry the Sixth
titleStmt.author: William Shakespeare

respStmt.name: Craig A. Berry, Martin Mueller, and Clifford Wulfman
Lawrence Berland, Hilary Bina, Katherine Gould, Kreg Segal, Nicholas Terrell

publicationStmt.p: The WordHoard Shakespeare is a joint project of the Perseus Project at Tufts University, The Northwestern University Library, and Northwestern University Academic Technologies. It is derived from The Globe Shakespeare , the one-volume version of the Cambridge Shakespeare , edited by W. G. Clark, J. Glover, and W. A. Wright (1891-3). The Internet Shakespeare editions of the quartos and folios have been consulted to create a modern text that observes as closely as possible the morphological and prosodic practices of the earliest editions. Spellings, especially of contracted and hyphenated forms, have been standardized across the corpus. The text has been fully lemmatized and morphosyntactically tagged.

Â© 2003. The copyright to The WordHoard Shakespeare is owned jointly by Northwestern University and Tufts University. The WordHoard Shakespeare is provided for free solely for non-commercial use by students, scholars, and the public. Any commercial use or publication of it, in whole or in part, without prior written authorization of the copyright holders is strictly prohibited.

sourceDesc.p: The Wordhoard Shakespeare is derived from, but not identical with, The Globe Shakespeare , the one-volume version of the Cambridge Shakespeare (1891-3) edited by W. G. Clark, J. Glover, and W. A. Wright.

castItem.roleDesc: Earl of March, afterwards King Edward IV

castGroup.head: Uncles to the Duke of York

castItem.role: A Son that has killed his father
A Father that has killed his son

div.head: Act 1, Scene 1
div.stage: Enter the DUKE OF YORK, EDWARD, RICHARD, NORFOLK, MONTAGUE, WARWICK, and Soldiers.

l.stage: Throwing down the Duke of Somerset's head.
Flourish. Enter KING HENRY, CLIFFORD, NORTHUMBERLAND, WESTMORELAND, EXETER, and the rest.
He stamps with his foot, and the Soldiers show themselves.
Exeunt York and his Sons, Warwick, Norfolk, Montague, their Soldiers, and Attendants.
Enter QUEEN MARGARET and the PRINCE OF WALES.
Exeunt Queen Margaret and the Prince.
Enter SIR JOHN MORTIMER and SIR HUGH MORTIMER.

div.head: Act 1, Scene 3
div.stage: Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.
Alarums. Enter RUTLAND and his Tutor.

div.head: Act 1, Scene 4
div.stage: Alarum. Enter RICHARD, Duke of York.

l.stage: Enter QUEEN MARGARET, CLIFFORD, NORTHUMBERLAND, the young Prince, and Soldiers.
They lay hands on York, who struggles.
Putting a paper crown on his head.

div.head: Act 2, Scene 1
div.stage: A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.
Enter EDWARD, RICHARD, and their power.

l.stage: March. Enter WARWICK, MARQUESS OF MONTAGUE, and their army.

div.head: Act 2, Scene 2
div.stage: Enter KING HENRY, QUEEN MARGARET, the PRINCE OF WALES, CLIFFORD,and NORTHUMBERLAND, with drum and trumpets.

l.stage: March. Enter EDWARD, GEORGE, RICHARD, WARWICK, NORFOLK, MONTAGUE, and Soldiers.

div.head: Act 2, Scene 3
div.stage: A field of battle between Towton and Saxton, in Yorkshire.

l.stage: Alarum. Enter a Son that has killed his father, dragging in the dead body.
Enter a Father that has killed his son, bringing in the body.
Enter QUEEN MARGARET, the PRINCE, and EXETER.
Enter EDWARD, GEORGE, RICHARD, MONTAGUE, WARWICK, and Soldiers.

div.head: Act 3, Scene 1
div.stage: A forest in the north of England.
Enter two Keepers, with cross-bows in their hands.

l.stage: Enter KING HENRY, disguised, with a prayerbook.

div.head: Act 3, Scene 2
div.stage: Enter KING EDWARD, GLOUCESTER, CLARENCE, and LADY GREY.

div.head: Act 3, Scene 3
div.stage: Enter LEWIS the French King, his sister BONA, his Admiral, called BOURBON: PRINCE EDWARD, QUEEN MARGARET, and the EARL OF OXFORD. LEWIS sits, and riseth up again.

l.stage: He gives his hand to Warwick.

div.head: Act 4, Scene 1
div.stage: Enter GLOUCESTER, CLARENCE, SOMERSET, and MONTAGUE.

l.stage: Enter KING EDWARD, attended; LADY GREY, as Queen; PEMBROKE, STAFFORD, HASTINGS, and others.

div.head: Act 4, Scene 2
div.stage: Enter WARWICK and OXFORD, with French soldiers.

div.head: Act 4, Scene 3
div.stage: Enter three Watchmen, to guard the KING'S tent.

l.stage: Enter WARWICK, CLARENCE, OXFORD, SOMERSET, and French soldiers, silent all.
Warwick and the rest cry all, âWarwick! Warwick!â and set upon the Guard, who fly, crying, âArm! arm!â Warwick and the rest following. them.
The drum playing and trumpet sounding,
re-enter WARWICK, SOMERSET, and the rest, bringing the KING out in his gown, sitting in a chair. RICHARD and HASTINGS fly over the stage.

div.head: Act 4, Scene 5
div.stage: A park near Middleham Castle in Yorkshire.
Enter GLOUCESTER, LORD HASTINGS, and SIR WILLIAM STANLEY.

l.stage: Enter KING EDWARD and a Huntsman with him.

div.head: Act 4, Scene 6
div.stage: Flourish. Enter KING HENRY, CLARENCE, WARWICK, SOMERSET, young RICHMOND, OXFORD, MONTAGUE, and Lieutenant of the Tower.

l.stage: Lays his hand on his head
Exeunt all but Somerset, Richmond, and Oxford.

div.head: Act 4, Scene 7
div.stage: Flourish. Enter KING EDWARD, GLOUCESTER, HASTINGS, and Soldiers.

l.stage: Enter, on the walls, the Mayor of York, and his brethren.
Enter the Mayor and two Aldermen, below.
March. Enter MONTGOMERY, with drum and soldiers.

div.head: Act 4, Scene 8
div.stage: Flourish. Enter KING HENRY, WARWICK, MONTAGUE, CLARENCE, EXETER, and OXFORD.

l.stage: Exeunt all but King and Exeter.
Shout within, âA Lancaster! A Lancaster!â
Enter KING EDWARD, GLOUCESTER, and soldiers.

div.head: Act 5, Scene 1
div.stage: Enter WARWICK, the Mayor of Coventry, two Messengers, and others upon the walls.

l.stage: March: flourish. Enter KING EDWARD, GLOUCESTER, and soldiers.
Enter OXFORD, with drum and colours.
He and his forces enter the city.
Enter MONTAGUE, with drum and colours.
He and his forces enter the city.
Enter SOMERSET, with drum and colours.
He and his forces enter the city.
Enter CLARENCE, with drum and colours.
Taking his red rose out of his hat.
Exeunt King Edward and his company,
March. Warwick and his company follow.

div.head: Act 5, Scene 2
div.stage: A field of battle near Barnet.
Alarum and excursions. Enter KING EDWARD, bringing forth WARWICK wounded.

l.stage: Here they bear away his body.

div.head: Act 5, Scene 3
div.stage: Flourish. Enter KING EDWARD in triumph; with GLOUCESTER, CLARENCE, and the rest.

div.head: Act 5, Scene 4
div.stage: March. Enter QUEEN MARGARET, PRINCE EDWARD, SOMERSET, OXFORD, and soldiers.

l.stage: Flourish and march. Enter KING EDWARD, GLOUCESTER, CLARENCE, and soldiers.

div.head: Act 5, Scene 5
div.stage: Flourish. Enter KING EDWARD, GLOUCESTER, CLARENCE, and soldiers; with QUEEN MARGARET, OXFORD, and SOMERSET, prisoners.

div.head: Act 5, Scene 6
div.stage: Enter KING HENRY and GLOUCESTER, with the Lieutenant, on the walls.

div.head: Act 5, Scene 7
div.stage: Flourish. Enter KING EDWARD, QUEEN ELIZABETH, CLARENCE, GLOUCESTER, HASTINGS, a Nurse with the young Prince, and Attendants.
